title: Github Python Samples - Missing Brackets
question:
And… slow loading of script editor after installing latest update (maybe just me??)


Here’s the link where I found the missing brackets. Some sort of formatting quirk:






github.com/mcneel/rhino-developer-samples






rhinopython/SampleMouseCallback.py




8




################################################################################
# SampleMouseCallback.py
# Copyright (c) 2019 Robert McNeel & Associates.
# See License.md in the root of this repository for details.
################################################################################
import scriptcontext as sc
import Rhino

# Demonstrates how to use RhinoCommon's MouseCallback class
class MouseCallbackClass(Rhino.UI.MouseCallback):

    def OnMouseDown(self, e):
        print "OnMouseDown",e.Button
    
    def OnEndMouseDown(self,e):
        print "OnEndMouseDown", e.Button

    def OnMouseUp(self,e):
        print "OnMouseUp",e.Button

################################################################################
# SampleMouseCallback.py
# Copyright (c) 2019 Robert McNeel & Associates.
# See License.md in the root of this repository for details.
################################################################################
import scriptcontext as sc
import Rhino

# Demonstrates how to use RhinoCommon's MouseCallback class
class MouseCallbackClass(Rhino.UI.MouseCallback):

    def OnMouseDown(self, e):
        print "OnMouseDown",e.Button
    
    def OnEndMouseDown(self,e):
        print "OnEndMouseDown", e.Button

    def OnMouseUp(self,e):
        print "OnMouseUp",e.Button
